required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Real-world Study on Edoxaban Treatment for Patients With Non-valvular Atrial Fibrillation in China
clinical_study.official_title: Real-world Study on Edoxaban Treatment in Routine Clinical Practice for Patients With Non-valvular Atrial Fibrillation in China

brief_summary.textblock: The safety of edoxaban treatment will be examined using real-world clinical evidence from adult patients with non-valvular atrial fibrillation (NVAF) indications in routine clinical practice.

detailed_description.textblock:
This non-interventional, observational study will evaluate the safety of edoxaban treatment in adult patients with NVAF indications with one or more risk factors.
The primary objective of the study is to collect and evaluate safety data up to 2 years in a real-world setting in relation to adverse event onset (related to edoxaban treatment), duration, severity, and outcome.
The secondary objective will evaluate the effect of edoxaban treatment on stroke (ischemic and hemorrhagic), systemic embolic event (SEE), transient ischemic attack (TIA), major adverse cardiovascular events (MACE), venous thromboembolism (VTE), acute coronary syndrome (ACS), hospitalization related to cardiovascular condition, extent of exposure and compliance to edoxaban therapy, and rate and reasons of permanent discontinuation of edoxaban therapy.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence (including 95% confidence intervals) of major bleeding events following edoxaban treatment
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 2 years post treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence (including 95% confidence intervals) of clinically related non-major bleeding events following edoxaban treatment
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 2 years post treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence (including 95% confidence intervals) of adverse events/adverse drug reactions following edoxaban treatment
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 2 years post treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence (including 95% confidence intervals) of mortality (cardiovascular and all-cause) following edoxaban treatment
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 2 years post treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence (including 95% confidence intervals) of stroke (ischemic and hemorrhagic) following edoxaban treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 2 years post treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence (including 95% confidence intervals) of systemic embolic event (SEE) following edoxaban treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 2 years post treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence (including 95% confidence intervals) of transient ischemic attack (TIA) following edoxaban treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 2 years post treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence (including 95% confidence intervals) of major adverse cardiovascular events (MACE) following edoxaban treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 2 years post treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence (including 95% confidence intervals) of venous thromboembolism (VTE) following edoxaban treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 2 years post treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence (including 95% confidence intervals) of acute coronary syndrome (ACS) following edoxaban treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 2 years post treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence (including 95% confidence intervals) of hospitalizations related to cardiovascular condition following edoxaban treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 2 years post treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of exposure to edoxaban treatment in NVAF patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 2 years post treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Compliance rate of edoxaban treatment in NVAF patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 2 years post treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of participants who discontinued edoxaban treatment in NVAF patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 2 years post treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of interventions related to atrial fibrillation/edoxaban in NVAF patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 2 years post treatment

arm_group.description: NVAF adult patients with one or more risk factors treated with edoxaban.

intervention.description: This is a non-interventional, observational study.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with NVAF treated with edoxaban will be enrolled in this non-interventional, observational study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Written, informed consent
- NVAF-patients treated with edoxaban according to packaging information (i.e., for NVAF adult patients with one or more risk factors (such as history of congestive heart failure, hypertension, age â‰¥75 years old, diabetes, prior stroke or TIA) in prevention of stroke and systemic circulation embolism)
- Not participating in any interventional study at the same time
Exclusion Criteria:
- Not applicable

patient_data.ipd_description: De-identified individual participant data (IPD) and applicable supporting clinical trial documents may be available upon request at https://vivli.org/. In cases where clinical trial data and supporting documents are provided pursuant to our company policies and procedures, Daiichi Sankyo will continue to protect the privacy of our clinical trial participants. Details on data sharing criteria and the procedure for requesting access can be found at this web address: https://vivli.org/ourmember/daiichi-sankyo/
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Studies for which the medicine and indication have received European Union (EU) and United States (US), and/or Japan (JP) marketing approval on or after 01 January 2014 or by the US or EU or JP Health Authorities when regulatory submissions in all regions are not planned and after the primary study results have been accepted for publication.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Formal request from qualified scientific and medical researchers on IPD and clinical study documents from clinical trials supporting products submitted and licensed in the United States, the European Union and/or Japan from 01 January 2014 and beyond for the purpose of conducting legitimate research. This must be consistent with the principle of safeguarding study participants' privacy and consistent with provision of informed consent.
